text:
Question 73) According to the most accepted evolutionary theory today, mitochondria, cell organelles responsible for the production of ATP in eukaryotes, as well as chloroplasts, would have originated from ancestral prokaryotes that were incorporated by more complex cells.
A characteristic of mitochondria that supports this theory is the
A) Ability to produce ATP molecules.
B) presence of cell wall similar to that of prokaryotes.
C) Presence of membranes surrounding and separating the mitochondrial matrix from the cytoplasm.
D) Capacity of self -circular DNA self -modification similar to bacterial.
E) presence of an efficient enzyme system to the chemical reactions of aerobic metabolism.
